content.json:
# Microsoft Sentinel and Azure Monitor Logs Commitment Tier Workbook

#### Author: [TheAlistairRoss](https://thealistairross0.wordpress.com/)

[If you have any feedback or issues, please submit them here](https://github.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/issues/new/choose)

parameters.name: DefaultSubscription_Internal
parameters.query:
where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| take 1
| project subscriptionId

parameters.name: InternalWSs
parameters.query:
SecurityIncident
| take 1
| parse IncidentUrl with * "/workspaces/" Workspace "/" *
| project Workspace

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| distinct subscriptionId, location
| summarize by value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)
| order by value asc

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| project id, name, subscriptionId
| join kind = inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == "microsoft.resources/subscriptions"
    | project subscriptionId, subscription = strcat(name," (",subscriptionId,")")
)
on subscriptionId
|project value = id, label = name, group = subscription

parameters.name: TimeRange
parameters.description: Time Range (UTC)
parameters.label: Time Range

parameters.name: CurrencyCode
parameters.description: This is the currency code which your billing account should be billed / charged in
parameters.label: Currency Code

parameters.name: E5Seats
parameters.label: E5 Seats
parameters.description: Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5, and G5 and Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5, and G5 Security customers can get a data grant of up to 5 MB per user per day of Microsoft 365 data ingestion into Microsoft Sentinel. Enter the number of the applied licences.

parameters.name: CustomPrices
parameters.label: Input Custom Prices

parameters.name: PricingModel
parameters.description: This defaults to your current pricing model. Change this if you wish to view the pricing on the different pricing model. Note! Switching to Classic from Unified provides no benefit as you cannot downgrade the pricing model once moved.. https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sentinel-blog/introducing-the-new-microsoft-sentinel-simplified-pricing/ba-p/3869145
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| where id =~ "{Workspace}"
| project workspaceId = tolower(id), ServiceType = "Log Analytics", sku = tostring(properties.sku.name)
| union (
    resources
    | where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
    | where plan.product == "OMSGallery/SecurityInsights"
    | where properties.workspaceResourceId has "{Workspace}"
    | project workspaceId = tolower(tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId)), ServiceType = "Sentinel", sku = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
    ) 
| extend Packed = pack_dictionary(ServiceType, sku)
| summarize ServiceTypes = make_list(ServiceType), Values = make_bag(Packed) by workspaceId
| project value = iif(
    ServiceTypes has "Sentinel", 
    iif (Values.Sentinel == "Unified", "Unified", "Classic"),
    "Log Analytics" 
    )
| extend
    label = value, 
    selected = true
| project value, label, selected

parameters.name: WorkspaceLocation
parameters.query:
resources
| where id == "{Workspace:id}"
| project location
| extend selected = true

parameters.name: LogAnalyticsCurrentTier
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
| where id has "{Workspace}"
| extend logAnalyticsSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
| project logAnalyticsTier = case(
    logAnalyticsSku =~ "pergb2018", "Pay-as-you-go",
    logAnalyticsSku =~ "capacityreservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel),
    "Not Supported in this workbook"
    )

parameters.name: SentinelCurrentTier
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
| where id == "{Workspace}"
| extend logAnalyticsSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
| project 
    workspaceId = tolower(id),
    logAnalyticsTier = case(
        logAnalyticsSku =~ "pergb2018", "Pay-as-you-go",
        logAnalyticsSku =~ "capacityreservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel),
        "Not Supported in this workbook"
        )
| join kind = fullouter (
    resources
    | where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
    | where plan.product == "OMSGallery/SecurityInsights"
    | where properties.workspaceResourceId has "{Workspace}"
    | extend workspaceId = tolower(tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId))
    | extend sentinelSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
) on workspaceId
| extend sentinelSku = iif(isempty(sentinelSku), "Sentinel Not Enabled", sentinelSku)
| project Tier = case(
        sentinelSku =~ "Unified", logAnalyticsTier,
        sentinelSku =~ "PerGB", "Pay-as-you-go",
        sentinelSku =~ "capacityreservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel),
        sentinelSku == "Sentinel Not Enabled", "Sentinel Not Enabled",
        "Not Supported in this workbook"
)

content.json:
## Help

Changing Commitment Tiers in Log Analytics and Microsoft Sentinel can be a daunting task. You have so many factors to take into account when making the calculation, including seasonality of your data, defender for servers plan 2 500MB per day allowance, E5, A5, F5 and G5 5MB per user per day allowance and the different table types. (Analytic and Basic logs). While the built in recommendation (on the commitment tier page) shows a simple table, I am constantly asked for more data to make an informed desicion. This workbook aims to address exactly that.

### Where can I used this workbook.
This workbook has been designed for Azure Monitor Logs (Log Analytic) workspaces that are on the perGB or Commitment tier skus, as well as workspaces that are enabled with Microsoft Sentinel (Unified or classic pricing models). 

It will not work for the legacy Free, Standalone and Per Node pricing tiers. 

It will also not work for multiple workspaces at this stage, due to api limitations.

### How does it work
This workbook calculates the recommendations and charts by performing the following:

1. Calculates your total billable usage for analytic tables only.

2. Calculates your [Defender for Servers Plan 2 data ingestion Allowance](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-ca/azure/defender-for-cloud/faq-defender-for-servers#is-the-500-mb-of-free-data-ingestion-allowance-applied-per-workspace-or-per-machine-) and subtracts that value from the applicable tables only. This value is worked out by calculating the number of distinct computers (by SourceComputerId) reporting to the workspace on a daily basis which have the *Security* solution listed in the Heartbeat table. 

3. Calculates your [Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5 and G5 Allowance](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-ca/pricing/offers/sentinel-microsoft-365-offer/) and removes that allowance from the applicable tables. This is based on a fixed value that you input for the selected period. It does not calculate any adjustment in the number of licences across the selected time period 

4. Fetches the retail price for the current month for the selected currency and Azure region. It does not calculate any historcal prices over previous months.

5. Applies any applicable discounts. This is via manual inputs at this stage, it can be a fixed value, as seen on the commitment tier page, or a percentage discount off the current retail price. If you are unsure, contact you Azure Security sales specialist.

6. Calculates the effective commitment tier threshold for when it is cost effective to move to the next tier. This is calculated based on the cost as you may have different discounts applied to different tiers as per your Microsoft agreement.

7. Calculates the total cost and charts for your current selected tier as well as provide a recommendation for the most cost effective tier based on your ingested data and time range.

7. Performs any other additional calculations for the neccessary for various charts. Review the help file for each of these to understand more.

## Required Parameters 

You need to ensure the following parameters are set:

|Parameter|Description|
|:--|:-- |
|**Subscription**|This is the subscription where your log analytics workspace resides.|
|**Workspace**|This is the Log Analytics workspace you are analysing.|
|**Time Range**:| This is the time period which you want to analyse in this workbook. **NOTE**: For the best results, only select complete day when analysing your data. This should start from 00:00:00 and end at 23:59:59. This ensures that the first and last days are not miscalculated.|
|**CurrencyCode**| This should be the currency which you are invoiced. Not everyone can view the billing information, so this is not looked up automatically.|
|**E5 Seats**|This is the total number of E5, A5, F5 and G5 licences purchased. This can be found [here](https://portal.azure.com/#view/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/LicensesMenuBlade/~/Products). This will default to zero.|

## Optional Parameters

|Parameter|Description|
|:--|:--|
|**Show Help**|You have already selected this, otherwise you would not be here. This presents helpful information all throughout the workbook. Switch this to know to hide these informational messages.|
|**Input Custom Prices**|This gives you the option to input your own custom prices. This is typically used when you have additional discounts applied by Microsoft. If this option is selected, expand the heading immediatly below and input the values. They will default to zero, so consider saving the workbook to maintain these values.|
|**Use Simulated Data**|Sometimes to realise value of workbooks, you need to simulate the data. This will change all the usage queries to use a simulated data which makes the recommendation to move to the 100 GB commitment tier. This has only been designed with a workspace at the pay-as-you-go tier and may not work as intended on other scenarios.|


## Please be aware!
> This workbook is dependant on an external GitHub repository (by default) found [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/main/Solutions/CostManagement/Prices). This is due to the fact that the prices api for Azure cannot be looked up directly from a workbook, so they are cached in this location. All prices are checked daily and are only updated if the has been a change, usually due to the exchange rate. 

> If you want to lookup the prices from your own repository, switch the workbook to edit mode and review the help file under the hidden URL and Query parameters.

# Simulated Data

By default, the simulated data will pull sample data from GitHub to show the value of this workbook. However by replacing the URL with a link to an accessible CSV file, in the format provided in the demo template, you can use this workbook for modelling data. This can be ideal for scenarios such as migrating from another SIEM to Microsoft Sentinel, or combining the data output from this workbook for multiple workspaces.

Multiple workspaces require this method as basic logs are identified via the REST API, which can only be done per workspace.

parameters.name: SimulatedDataURL
parameters.label: Simulated Data URL
parameters.description: The is the URL for a CSV file which is being imported and displayed within this workbook. Refer to the help file for detailed information

parameters.name: UseSimulatedDataDates
parameters.label: Use Simulated Data Dates

criteriaContext.resultVal: let UseSimulatedDataDates = {UseSimulatedDataDates}; let Data =  materialize(     externaldata(StartTime: datetime, QuantityMB: real, DefenderForCloudReductionMB: real, E5ReductionMB: real)[h"{SimulatedDataURL}"] with(format="csv", ignoreFirstRecord=true)     ); let DataCount = toscalar(Data     | count); let UsageMetrics = Data | order by StartTime asc | extend SubtractDays = (DataCount - row_number()) * 1d | extend StartTime = iff(     UseSimulatedDataDates == true, StartTime,     startofday(ago(SubtractDays)) ) | extend JoinColumn = 1 | project StartTime, QuantityMB, DefenderForCloudReductionMB, E5ReductionMB, JoinColumn;

parameters.name: SimulatedPricingModel
parameters.label: Simulated Pricing Model
parameters.description: Change this whe you want to simulate a different pricing model to the current pricing model for the given workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Unified", "Classic", "Log Analytics"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{PricingModel}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

parameters.name: SimulatedSentinelTier
parameters.label: Simulated Sentinel Tier
parameters.description: Change this when you want to simulated the current Sentinel tier as a different one.
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{SentinelCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

parameters.name: SimulatedAzureMonitorLogsTier
parameters.label: Simulated Azure Monitor Logs Tier
parameters.description: Change this when you want to simulated the current Sentinel tier as a different one.
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

items.name: parameters - Azure Monitor Logs Simulated Tiers

{SimulatedDataQuery}
UsageMetrics
content.title: Simulated Data

# Intentionally hidden - URL and Query Parameters These parameters are only used in advanced scenarios. This contain the Urls and queries used for the external data queries and are constructed based on selected parameters. They allow the correct file to be referenced from the selected repository. Do not modify these unless you know what you are doing! |Parameter|Description|Default Value| |:--|:--|:--| |RepositoryURL|This is the base URL for the repository|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/main/Solutions/CostManagement/Prices| |AzureMonitorPricesCSVURL|This is the combination of the RepositoryURL, WorkbookLocation and CurrencyCode parameters which makes up the exact file uri for Azure Monitor Prices. This should NOT be ammended, unless you are changing the folder structure|\{RepositoryURL\}/Classic/Azure%20Monitor/\{WorkspaceLocation\}/\{CurrencyCode\}_Prices.csv| |SentinelPricesCSVURL|This is the combination of the RepositoryURL, WorkbookLocation, CurrencyCode and PricingModel parameters which makes up the exact file uri for Azure Monitor Prices. This should NOT be ammended, unless you are changing the folder structure|\{RepositoryURL\}/Classic/Azure%20Monitor/\{WorkspaceLocation\}/\{CurrencyCode\}_Prices.csv| |SentinelPricesCSVURL|This has two values based on the workspace pricing model.|PricingModel == "Log Analytics" = \{RepositoryURL\}/Classic/Sentinel/\{WorkspaceLocation\}/\{CurrencyCode\}_Prices.csv"

DefaultCriteria = \{RepositoryURL\}/\{PricingModel\}/Sentinel/\{WorkspaceLocation\}/\{CurrencyCode\}_Prices.csv| ## Once the repository has been updated, check the charts and troubleshooting section to ensure data is being loaded. It should be possbile to load the prices using a SAS url, but this has not been tested for this workbook. # No other parameters should be edited as they are lookups and queries for all the charts to work.

criteriaContext.resultVal: externaldata(TimeGenerated : datetime , ServiceName: string , ArmRegionName: string, CurrencyCode: string, MeterName: string, Tier: string, UnitOfMeasure: string, RetailPrice: real , EffectiveStartDate:datetime , EffectiveCommitmentTierThresholdGB:real , EffectivePricePerGB:real)[  h"{AzureMonitorPricesCSVURL}" ] with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)

externaldata(TimeGenerated : datetime , ServiceName: string , ArmRegionName: string, CurrencyCode: string, MeterName: string, Tier: string, UnitOfMeasure: string, RetailPrice: real , EffectiveStartDate:datetime , EffectiveCommitmentTierThresholdGB:real , EffectivePricePerGB:real)[  h"{SentinelPricesCSVURL}" ] with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)

parameters.name: BasicTables
parameters.query: {"version":"ARMEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[],"method":"GET","path":"{Workspace}/tables?api-version=2022-10-01","urlParams":[],"batchDisabled":false,"transformers":[{"type":"jsonpath","settings":{"tablePath":"$.value[?(@.properties.plan == 'Basic')]","columns":[{"path":"$.name","columnid":"Table","columnType":"string"}]}}]}

parameters.name: ApplyDefenderAllowanceToUpdateTables
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project JoinColumn = 1
| join kind = fullouter(
    resources
    | where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
    | where plan.product == "OMSGallery/Updates"
    | where properties.workspaceResourceId has "{Workspace}"
    | project id, configurations = properties.configurations
    | extend JoinColumn = 1
)   on JoinColumn
| extend Result = case(
    isempty(id), "true",
    array_length(configurations) > 0, "true",
    "false"
)
|project Result

criteriaContext.resultVal: let BasicTables = toscalar(print Basic = "{BasicTables}"      | extend Basic = split(substring(Basic, 1, strlen(Basic) - 2), ',')); let E5Seats = {E5Seats}; let E5AllowancePerDayMB = E5Seats * 5; let E5Tables = dynamic([{E5Tables}]); let E5Usage = Usage      | where StartTime >= TimeRangeStart and StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd      | where IsBillable == true      | where DataType in (E5Tables)      | make-series Quantity = sum(Quantity) default = 0 on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d      | mv-expand Quantity to typeof(long), StartTime to typeof(datetime)      | extend E5ReductionMB = iff(E5AllowancePerDayMB - Quantity > 0, Quantity, E5AllowancePerDayMB)      | project StartTime, E5ReductionMB; let DefenderForCloudPerDeviceAllowanceMB = 500; let DefenderForCloudTables = dynamic([{DefenderForCloudTables}]); let DefenderForCloudUpdateTables = dynamic(["Update", "UpdateSummary"]); let DefenderForCloudUsage = Heartbeat      | where TimeGenerated >= TimeRangeStart and TimeGenerated <= TimeRangeEnd      | where Solutions has "\"security\""      | make-series DeviceCount = dcount(SourceComputerId, 4) default = 0 on TimeGenerated from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d      | mv-expand DeviceCount to typeof(int), TimeGenerated to typeof(datetime)      | extend DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB = DefenderForCloudPerDeviceAllowanceMB * DeviceCount      | project TimeGenerated, DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB      | join kind = rightouter (Usage          | where StartTime >= TimeRangeStart and StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd          | where IsBillable == true          | where DataType in (DefenderForCloudTables)          | make-series Quantity = sum(Quantity) default = 0 on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d          | mv-expand Quantity to typeof(long), StartTime to typeof(datetime))         on $left.TimeGenerated == $right.StartTime      | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB - Quantity > 0, Quantity, DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB)      | project StartTime, DefenderForCloudReductionMB; let UsageMetrics =  Usage      | where StartTime >= TimeRangeStart and StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd      | where IsBillable == true      | where DataType !in (BasicTables)      | make-series kind=nonempty QuantityMB = sum(Quantity) default = 0 on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d      | mv-expand QuantityMB to typeof(long), StartTime to typeof(datetime)      | join kind = leftouter (E5Usage) on StartTime      | join kind = leftouter (DefenderForCloudUsage) on StartTime      | extend E5ReductionMB = case(PricingModel == "Log Analytics", 0,isempty(E5ReductionMB), 0, E5ReductionMB)      | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(isempty(DefenderForCloudReductionMB), 0, DefenderForCloudReductionMB)      | project StartTime, QuantityMB, DefenderForCloudReductionMB, E5ReductionMB      | extend JoinColumn = 1;

content.json:
# Custom Prices

By default, this workbook calculates the cost based on the retail price for the relevant meters for the current month. Depending on your agreement with Microsoft, you may have discounts that are applicable. 

This input gives you the ability to input a fixed price for the selected sku, or a percentage reduction off the retail price for the selected sku. 

## Fixed Prices
If your discounts are a fixed value, change the parameter "*Fixed or Percentage*" to "**Fixed**" then enter the value as provided on your agreement. E.g. Pay-as-you-go = 2.35 - This would mean that you would pay 2.35 for the selected meter in your selected currency.

## Percentage
If your discounts are a percentage reduction, change the parameter "*Fixed or Percentage*" to "**Percentage**" then select the value from the drop down as provided on your agreement. E.g. Pay-as-you-go = 20 - This would mean you would be charged the retail price minus 20% for your region and currency.

> **Note:** Your agreements may be specific to regions, ensure that you have entered the correct values.

> If you do not need to use custom prices, ensure you switch the parameter "*Input Custom Prices*" to "**No**" at the top of this workbook. This will ensure that the current retail prices are used, regardless of what custom price is input.

> You may need to refresh the charts after ammending these values or save the workbook and reload it to get the best results.

items.name: text - Input Custom Prices - Help Message

parameters.name: FixedOrPercentage
parameters.label: Fixed Or Percentage
parameters.description: If your Microsoft applied discounts are a fixed price, select "Fixed". If they are a percentage discount off the current retail price, select "Percentage"

items.name: parameters - Input Custom Prices - Fixed or Percentage

content.json:
# SIMULATED DATA
## This workbook is currently displaying usage data for demonstration purposes. Ensure you turn this parameter off in production

items.name: text - Main Page - Simulated Data Warning

content.query:
let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start});
let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end});
let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}";
let SentinelCurrentTier = "{SentinelCurrentTier}";
let LogAnalyticsCurrentTier = "{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}";
let SentinelPriceInputs = {SentinelPrices};
let LogAnalyticsPriceInputs = {AzureMonitorPrices};
let PriceInputs = union SentinelPriceInputs, LogAnalyticsPriceInputs 
    | extend TierVolumeGB = iif(Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", 0, toint(Tier))     
    | project ServiceName, Tier, TierVolumeGB, SkuPrice, SkuEffectivePricePerGB  
    | extend JoinColumn = 1;   
{UsageMetrics} 
let TierStats = 
    UsageMetrics  
    | join kind = inner (PriceInputs) 
        on JoinColumn  
    | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB)
    | extend E5ReductionMB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB)
    | extend QuantityMB = case(
                              ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"),
                              QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB, 
                              QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB
                          )
    | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3
    | extend CostAtTier = iff(QuantityGB > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", QuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB, SkuPrice)  
    | summarize CostAtTier = sum(CostAtTier), QuantityGB = sum(QuantityGB) by Tier, ServiceName  
    | extend JoinColumn = 1;
TierStats
| where (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and Tier == SentinelCurrentTier and PricingModel in ("Unified", "Classic")) or (ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" and Tier == LogAnalyticsCurrentTier and PricingModel in ("Classic", "Log Analytics"))
| join kind = inner(TierStats
    | summarize arg_min(CostAtTier, Tier, JoinColumn) by ServiceName)
    on ServiceName
| extend Status = case(
                      Tier == Tier1,
                      "Good",
                      "Change Tier"
                  )
| project-rename 
    CurrentTier = Tier,
    RecommendedTier = Tier1,
    CurrentTierCost = CostAtTier,
    RecommendedTierCost = CostAtTier1
| extend CostDifference = RecommendedTierCost - CurrentTierCost
| order by ServiceName desc
| extend ServiceName = case(
    ServiceName =~ "Sentinel", strcat(" ",ServiceName),
    ServiceName =~ "Azure Monitor", strcat(" ",ServiceName),
    ServiceName
)
| project
    ServiceName,
    CurrentTier,
    RecommendedTier,
    Status,
    CurrentTierCost = round(CurrentTierCost,4),
    RecommendedTierCost = round(RecommendedTierCost,4),
    CostDifference = round(CostDifference,4)

# Commitment Tier Recommendations

This table view displays the current tiers for Microsoft Sentinel. It shows the optimal tier to be on based on the selected time range. It does this by calculating the total cost at each tier and returns the cost for the current tier and the lowest price tier in the selected time range. 

Because of this, the recommended tier may not always be the most optimal if you have recently made changes to data ingestion, such as increasing or decreasing. Always review the charts page

content.query:
let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start});
let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end});
let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}";
let SentinelCurrentTier = "{SentinelCurrentTier}";
let LogAnalyticsCurrentTier = "{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}";
let SentinelCurrentTierValue = iif(SentinelCurrentTier =~ "Pay-as-you-go", 0, toint(SentinelCurrentTier));
let LogAnalyticsCurrentTierValue = iif(LogAnalyticsCurrentTier =~ "Pay-as-you-go", 0, toint(LogAnalyticsCurrentTier));
{UsageMetrics}  
UsageMetrics
| extend ServiceName = dynamic(["Azure Monitor", "Sentinel"])
| mv-expand ServiceName to typeof(string)
| summarize
    QuantityMB = sum(QuantityMB),
    DefenderForCloudReductionMB = sum(DefenderForCloudReductionMB),
    E5ReductionMB = sum(E5ReductionMB)
    by ServiceName
| extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3
| extend BillableQuantityGB = case(
                                  ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"),
                                  (QuantityMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB - E5ReductionMB) / 1e3, 
                                  (QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB) / 1e3
                              )
| extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(
                                           ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"),
                                           DefenderForCloudReductionMB / 1e3, 
                                           toreal(0)
                                       )
| extend E5ReductionGB = E5ReductionMB / 1e3
| extend TierValue = iff(ServiceName =~ "Sentinel", SentinelCurrentTierValue, LogAnalyticsCurrentTierValue)
| extend AboveCommitmentTierGB = iff(BillableQuantityGB >= TierValue, BillableQuantityGB - TierValue, toreal(0))
| extend BelowCommitmentTierGB = BillableQuantityGB - AboveCommitmentTierGB
| where (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel in ("Unified", "Classic")) or (ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" and PricingModel in ("Classic", "Log Analytics"))
| extend
    Message = iif(ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel != "Unified", "Defender For Cloud 500MB per server/day only applicable to Microsoft Sentinel on the new Unified pricing model","")
| order by ServiceName desc
| extend ServiceName = case(
    ServiceName =~ "Sentinel", strcat(" ",ServiceName),
    ServiceName =~ "Azure Monitor", strcat(" ",ServiceName),
    ServiceName
)
| project
    ServiceName,
    QuantityGB = round(QuantityGB,3),
    DefenderForCloudReductionGB = round(DefenderForCloudReductionGB, 3),
    E5ReductionGB = round(E5ReductionGB,3),
    BelowCommitmentTierGB = round(BelowCommitmentTierGB,3),
    AboveCommitmentTierGB = round(AboveCommitmentTierGB,3),
    BillableQuantityGB = round(BillableQuantityGB,3),
    Message

content.json:
# Commitment Tier Parameters

These charts require the selection of the Commitment tier parameter. By default, the current tier is selected. If you have the classic Sentinel pricing, with Azure Monitor Logs and Sentinel seperately billed, you will have to pick each parameter independently, otherwise there will only be one drop down parameter to choose from. 

> TIP: You can select all the tiers at once, but it is recommended to select your current tier, the recommended tier and at least one other (the next one up or down). For example if your current tier is 100 and the recommend tier is 200, select 100, 200 and 300. Check the Overview page higher up for the current recommendation based on your selected time range. 

- Details for changing Microsoft Sentinel Commitment Tiers: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/billing-reduce-costs#set-or-change-pricing-tier

parameters.name: SentinelCT
parameters.label: Sentinel Commitment Tier
parameters.description: Microsoft Sentinel Commitment Tier. You can select multiple tiers to model your data costs with. By default you current tier should be selected.
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{SentinelCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

parameters.name: LogAnalyticsCT
parameters.label: Azure Monitor Logs Commitment Tier
parameters.description: Azure Monitor Logs (Log Analytics) Commitment Tier. You can select multiple tiers to model your data costs with. By default you current tier should be selected.
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

# Charts Color Coding

Each Tier shown in the charts should be color coded as per the below legend. (All except for the forecasting charts which only show one tier at a time)

criteriaContext.resultVal: let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start}); let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end}); let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; {UsageMetrics}  UsageMetrics | join kind = inner (PriceInputs     | where Tier in (SelectedTiers))     on JoinColumn | project-away JoinColumn, JoinColumn1 | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = toreal(column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB)) | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionMB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionMB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) | extend BillableQuantityGB = (QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB) /1e3 | extend CostAtTier = iff(BillableQuantityGB > TierVolumeGB, BillableQuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB, SkuPrice) | make-series CostAtTier = sum(CostAtTier), BillableQuantityGB = sum(BillableQuantityGB) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d by Tier | extend MovingAverageFilter = iif(array_length(CostAtTier) < 7, array_length(CostAtTier), 7) | extend CostMovingAverage = series_fir(CostAtTier, repeat(1, MovingAverageFilter), true, false) | extend BillableQuantityGBMovingAverage = series_fir(BillableQuantityGB, repeat(1, MovingAverageFilter), true, false) | render timechart

let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start}); let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end}); let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; {UsageMetrics}  let Actual_Usage_GB =      UsageMetrics  | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = toreal(column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB)) | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionMB, toreal(0))  | extend E5ReductionMB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB)  | extend BillableQuantityGB = (QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB) / 1e3 | make-series BillableQuantityGB = toreal(round(sum(BillableQuantityGB), 3)) default = toreal(0) on StartTime step 1d  | project SeriesName = "Actual_Usage_GB", StartTime, BillableQuantityGB; let Average_Usage_GB =      Actual_Usage_GB  | extend Stats = series_stats_dynamic(BillableQuantityGB)  | project SeriesName = "Average_Usage_GB", StartTime, BillableQuantityGB = repeat(toreal(Stats.avg), array_length(BillableQuantityGB)); let UsageTimeRange =     toscalar(Actual_Usage_GB  | project StartTime); let CommitmentTierCalculations = PriceInputs  | extend StartTime = UsageTimeRange  | extend BillableQuantityGB = repeat(toreal(SkuEffectiveCommitmentTierThreshold), array_length(StartTime))  | project SeriesName = tostring(Tier), StartTime, BillableQuantityGB; union CommitmentTierCalculations, Actual_Usage_GB, Average_Usage_GB  | render timechart

let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start});   let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end});  let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}";  let TierValueMB = iff(CurrentTier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(0), toreal(toint(CurrentTier) * 1e3));  {UsageMetrics}     UsageMetrics | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = toreal(column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB)) | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionMB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionMB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) | extend QuantityMB =  QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB | extend AboveCommitmentTierMB = iff(QuantityMB >= TierValueMB, QuantityMB - TierValueMB, toreal(0)) | extend BelowCommitmentTierMB = QuantityMB - AboveCommitmentTierMB | project     StartTime,     DefenderForCloudReductionMB,     E5ReductionMB,     AboveCommitmentTierMB,     BelowCommitmentTierMB

content.json:
# Sum of Daily Costs

These charts show the retail cost for  Azure Monitor Logs and / or Microsoft Sentinel based on the selected commitment tiers and current usage. 

If your pricing model is "Log Analytics" or "Unified", only one chart will be displayed, otherwise two will be displayed, one for Log Analytics and another for Microsoft Sentinel as they are billed seperately in the classic model.

For example if you change the parameter **Sentinel Commitment Tier** to *Pay-as-you-go* and *500*, the chart "Sum of Daily Sentinel Cost" would display two series for each selected tier. Each series would reflect the retail prices that would have been paid based on the selected tiers.

When trying to interpret these costs , the legend below each chart shows the total cost for the selected time range, with the most expensive tier on the left and the best value on the right.

content.json:
# Moving Average Costs

These charts show the moving average costs for Azure Monitor Logs and / or Microsoft Sentinel based on the selected commitment tiers and current usage. 

If your pricing model is "Log Analytics" or "Unified", only one chart will be displayed, otherwise two will be displayed, one for Log Analytics and another for Microsoft Sentinel as they are billed seperately in the classic model.

In statistics, a moving average is a calculation to analyze data points by creating a series of averages of different subsets of the full data set. This is used in this example to smooth out short term fluctuations in the data and to highlight weekly trends. This chart has been set to a seven day moving average to analyse moving averages over a week.

For example if you change the parameter **Sentinel Commitment Tier** to *Pay-as-you-go* and *500*, the chart "Sentinel 7 Day Moving Average Cost" would display the two series for each selected tier. Each series would reflect the moving averages cost based on the selected tiers.

content.json:
# GB Ingested and Thresholds

These charts show the actual and average ingestion of billable data for for Azure Monitor Logs and / or Microsoft Sentinel based on the selected commitment tiers and current usage, including Defender for Servers Plan 2 and E5 deductions. 

It also visualises the thresholds which the selected commitment tiers become cost effective.

If your pricing model is "Log Analytics" or "Unified", only one chart will be displayed, otherwise two will be displayed, one for Log Analytics and another for Microsoft Sentinel as Defender for Servers Plan 2 allowances were only applicable to Azure Monitor Logs, and not Microsoft Sentinel.


For example if you change the parameter **Sentinel Commitment Tier** to *Pay-as-you-go* and *500*, the chart "Sentinel Billable Data Ingested and Commitment Tier Thresholds" would display two series for each selected tier. It would also display two series called *"Average Billable Usage"* and *"Billable Usage"*

If the Billable Usage and / or Average Billable Usage is higher than a displayed commitment tier, then it would be highly likely that moving to the next tier would be cost effective. Review the moving averages and recommendations charts.

content.json:
# Ingestion Allowances


These charts show the breakdown of ingested data into Azure Monitor Logs and / or Microsoft Sentinel based on the selected commitment tiers and current usage, including Defender for Servers Plan 2 and E5 deductions. 

If your pricing model is "Log Analytics" or "Unified", only one chart will be displayed, otherwise two will be displayed, one for Log Analytics and another for Microsoft Sentinel as Defender for Servers Plan 2 allowances were only applicable to Azure Monitor Logs, and not Microsoft Sentinel.

## The chart displays the data in the following way:

- Each vertical bar represents the total billable ingested data for that day into Analytics logs, including Defender for Servers Plan 2 and E5 Ingestion.

- In **orange**, each bar will show the 
daily [Defender for Servers Plan 2 data ingestion Deductions](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-ca/azure/defender-for-cloud/faq-defender-for-servers#is-the-500-mb-of-free-data-ingestion-allowance-applied-per-workspace-or-per-machine-) from the daily total ingestion. 


- In **purple (amethyst)**, each bar will show the daily [Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5 and G5 Deductions](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-ca/pricing/offers/sentinel-microsoft-365-offer/) from the daily total ingestion.

- In **green**, billable data that is ingested and is below the commitment tier will be shown (after Defender for Servers Plan 2 and E5 Dedcutions). This isn't to be confused with you minimum daily cost of the tier.

- In **blue**, billable data that is ingested, which is above the commitment tier threshold will be shown (after Defender for Servers Plan 2 and E5 Dedcutions)

- In **bright red**, If your commitment tier is 100 GB per day or higher, a dashed line will be displayed to show the commitment tier threshold. E.g If your tier is 100 GB, then the threshold line will be displayed at 100 GB.

> ### DATA EXPORT
If exporting data to combine workspace data into a single CSV, use the export function on this chart.

content.json:
# GB Pricing Forecasted

These charts show the current ingestion cost the forecasted ingestion costs based of billable data for Azure Monitor Logs and / or Microsoft Sentinel. It does this by performing trend analyse against you data in the given time range and models that trend into the future.

If your pricing model is "Log Analytics" or "Unified", only one chart will be displayed, otherwise two will be displayed, one for Log Analytics and another for Microsoft Sentinel as Defender for Servers Plan 2 allowances were only applicable to Azure Monitor Logs, and not Microsoft Sentinel.

### Parameters

- **Days Forecasted**: This is the number of days / weeks into the future you wish to project your data.

- **Sentinel / Azure Monitor Tier**: Select the tier you are modelling the costs on. By default the current tier should be selected.

### Reading the chart

When making forecasting predictions, the more data you have historically, the more accurate the forecasting is. It is also worth noting the further in the future the data goes, the less accurate the prediction is.

When observing these charts, you will see two series. 
- **Current Billable costs**: This area, colored **Light Blue**, represents the current cost based on the pricing unputs and current usage. At the end of the selected time range, it will drop to 0.

- **Forecasted Billable Costs**: This area, colored **Pink**, represents the trend of data, with anomalous data samples removed. This will start at the end of the "*Current Billable Costs*" to simulate the next days / weeks ahead

>Note: Forecasting cannot predict for unexpected changes that have not happened regularlly in the historical data, such as onboarding of new data sources. Also if seasonality cannot be detected , then it will display a line of best fit.

parameters.name: DaysInFuture
parameters.label: Days Forecasted
parameters.description: This is used to calculate how many days in the future should the forecasting charts predict.

parameters.name: SentinelSelectedForecastTier
parameters.label: Sentinel Tier
parameters.description: Select the Microsoft Sentinel Tier to model your costs. You can only select one tier at a time.
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{SentinelCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

parameters.name: LogAnalyticsSelectedForecastTier
parameters.label: Azure Monitor Logs Tier
parameters.description: Select the Azure Monitor Logs Tier to model your costs. You can only select one tier at a time.
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

criteriaContext.resultVal: let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start}); let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end}); let DaysForecastedPastEnd = {DaysInFuture}; let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; {UsageMetrics}   UsageMetrics | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = toreal(column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB)) | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionMB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionMB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) | extend BillableQuantityGB = (QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB) / 1e3 | make-series BillableQuantityGB = sum(BillableQuantityGB) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d | extend BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted = series_decompose_forecast(BillableQuantityGB, DaysForecastedPastEnd, -1, 'avg') | mv-expand StartTime to typeof(datetime), BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted to typeof(real), BillableQuantityGB to typeof(real) | extend BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted = iff(StartTime < (TimeRangeEnd -1d), toreal(0), BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted)

let TimeRangeStart = todatetime({TimeRange:start}); let TimeRangeEnd = todatetime({TimeRange:end}); let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; let DaysForecastedPastEnd = {DaysInFuture};  {UsageMetrics}  UsageMetrics | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = toreal(column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB)) | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionMB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionMB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) | extend BillableQuantityGB = (QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB) / 1e3 | make-series BillableQuantityGB = sum(BillableQuantityGB) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d | extend BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted = series_decompose_forecast(BillableQuantityGB, DaysForecastedPastEnd, -1, 'avg') | mv-expand     BillableQuantityGB to typeof(real),     BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted to typeof(real),     StartTime to typeof(datetime) | extend JoinColumn = 1 | join kind = inner (PriceInputs) on JoinColumn | project     StartTime,     BillableQuantityGB,     Tier,     BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted,     TierVolumeGB,     SkuEffectivePricePerGB,     SkuPrice | extend CostAtTier = iif(BillableQuantityGB > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(BillableQuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB), toreal(SkuPrice)) | extend CostAtTier_Forecasted = iff(BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted * SkuEffectivePricePerGB), toreal(SkuPrice)) | make-series CostAtTier = any(CostAtTier), Forecasted = any(CostAtTier_Forecasted) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d | extend CostAtTier = series_fir(CostAtTier, repeat(1, 7), true, false) | extend Forecasted = series_fir(Forecasted, repeat(1, 7), true, false) | mv-expand StartTime to typeof(datetime), CostAtTier to typeof(real), Forecasted to typeof(real) | extend CostAtTier = iff(StartTime > TimeRangeEnd, toreal(0), CostAtTier) | extend Forecasted = iff(StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd , toreal(0), Forecasted)

content.json:
# Forecasted 7 Day Moving Average

These charts operate similar to above and show the current ingestion cost the forecasted ingestion costs based of billable data for Azure Monitor Logs and / or Microsoft Sentinel. It does this by performing trend analyse against you data in the given time range and models that trend into the future. Further more it applies a [finite impulse response](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/series-firfunction) filter on the data to calculate the moving average and "smooth" the data.

If your pricing model is "Log Analytics" or "Unified", only one chart will be displayed, otherwise two will be displayed, one for Log Analytics and another for Microsoft Sentinel as Defender for Servers Plan 2 allowances were only applicable to Azure Monitor Logs, and not Microsoft Sentinel.


### Reading the chart

When making forecasting predictions, the more data you have historically, the more accurate the forecasting is. It is also worth noting the further in the future the data goes, the less accurate the prediction is. This chart does not make a line of best fit, but shows the average daily ingestion based on a seven day period (three days either side of the sample). Because of this, the beginning of the data will "climb" to the daily average.

When observing these charts, you will see two series. 
- **Current Billable costs**: This area, colored **Light Blue**, represents the seven day moving average cost based on the pricing unputs and current usage. At the end of the selected time range, it will drop to 0.

- **Forecasted Billable Costs**: This area, colored **Pink**, represents the seven day moving average trend of data, with anomalous data samples removed. This will start at the end of the "*Current Billable Costs*" to simulate the next days / weeks ahead

> Note: Forecasting cannot predict for unexpected changes that have not happened regularlly in the historical data, such as onboarding of new data sources.

content.title: Sentinel Forecasted 7 Day Moving Average Cost for Tier "{SentinelSelectedForecastTier}" in {CurrencyCode}
Azure Monitor Logs Forecasted 7 Day Moving Average Cost for Tier "{LogAnalyticsSelectedForecastTier}" in {CurrencyCode}

content.json:
This troubleshooting guide takes you through the steps for resolving the external pricing data. For all other issues, ensure you have read access to you Azure Log Analytics workspace were Microsoft Sentinel resides.

Read access is also required to Microsoft Sentinel, if the workspace is enabled with Microsoft Sentinel.

This troubleshooting table displays the following information

- **ServiceName** : This will either be "Azure Monitor" or "Sentinel". 
	- If you are expecting Sentinel to be display and it is not, review your permissions.


- **PricingModel** :This will be either "Unified",  "Classic" or "Log Analytics"
	- **Unified** will show if you have a Microsoft Sentinel enabled workspace on the [new pricing model](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sentinel-blog/introducing-the-new-microsoft-sentinel-simplified-pricing/ba-p/3869145#:~:text=We%20are%20excited%20to%20announce%20the%20new%20simplified,is%20rolling%20out%20for%20all%20regions%20throughout%20July.).
	- **Classic** will show if you have not moved to the new pricing model.
	- **Log Analytics** will show if Microsoft Sentinel is not enabled on your workspace **OR** you do not have read permissions to the SecurityInsights solution.


- **CurrencyCode**: This is your selected currency code. The currency codes are as per the [supported currencies](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/cost-management/retail-prices/azure-retail-prices#supported-currencies).


- **ArmRegionName**: This should be the Azure Region name for your Log Analytics Workspace.


- **IsData**: This validates that the data can be loaded with the [External Data](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/externaldata-operator?pivots=azuremonitor) function.


- **Url**: This is the url for the repository where the pricing will be looked up from. You should be able to follow the link and view the raw CSV. 

If the url does not work, identify the fault (if possible) or submit an issue [here](https://github.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/issues). Ensure you provide all the details shown in the table below.

If the results shows a warning message, this may suggests that the external data query has not been loaded as the url is incorrect or the file is inaccessible. Identify which URL is failing. This can be done by observing the **IsData** column and looking for those that are **False**. If possible, try and identify the issue and submit all the details from the table [here](https://github.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/issues).

content.query:
let sentinelData = {SentinelExternalData};
let azureMonitorData = {AzureMonitorExternalData};
let currencyCode = "{CurrencyCode}";
let armRegionName = "{WorkspaceLocation}";
let Service = dynamic([{"ServiceName": "Sentinel", "Url" : "{SentinelPricesCSVURL}"},{"ServiceName": "Azure Monitor", "Url" : "{AzureMonitorPricesCSVURL}"}]);
let externalDataTest = union azureMonitorData, sentinelData
    | distinct ServiceName
    | extend IsData = true;
print
    ServiceName = Service,
    CurrencyCode = currencyCode,
    ArmRegionName = armRegionName 
| mvexpand ServiceName
 | evaluate bag_unpack(ServiceName)
| join kind=fullouter (externalDataTest) on ServiceName
| project-away ServiceName1
| extend IsData = iif(IsData == true, true, false)
| extend PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"
| extend Info = "info"
| order by ServiceName asc
| project Info, ServiceName, PricingModel, CurrencyCode, ArmRegionName, IsData, Url
